name: Azlan Ontology Unified Glossary
description: Unified glossary of all terms across the Azlan EA-AAA ontology ecosystem

EMC-ONT.EnterpriseModelComposition: Orchestration ontology that maps requirement scopes to ontology compositions based on context filtering
EMC-ONT.ScopingDimension: Filter criteria for selecting applicable ontology data (contextLevel, instanceId, productContext, orgRolesGovernance, orgContext)
EMC-ONT.RequirementCategory: Classification of enterprise requirements (STRATEGIC, PRODUCT, PPM, COMPETITIVE, ORG-DESIGN, PROCESS, ENTERPRISE, AGENTIC)
EMC-ONT.CompositionRule: Pattern for assembling ontology graphs (Hub-Spoke, Lineage Chain, Bridge-Join)
EMC-ONT.AgenticBuildSupport: Capability for AI-augmented solution development using ontologies as technology-agnostic layer

ORG-ONT.Organization: Core organizational entity representing a company, division, or business unit
ORG-ONT.OrganizationContext: Bridge entity connecting an organization to domain-specific contexts
ORG-ONT.OrganizationStructure: Hierarchical arrangement of organizational units and reporting relationships

ORG-CONTEXT.ContextHub: Central connection point linking organizations to all domain contexts via bridge pattern
ORG-CONTEXT.hasStrategicContext: Bridge relationship connecting to VE-VSOM-ONT strategic planning
ORG-CONTEXT.hasCompetitiveLandscape: Bridge relationship connecting to CL-ONT market intelligence
ORG-CONTEXT.hasMaturityProfile: Bridge relationship connecting to ORG-MAT-ONT assessment
ORG-CONTEXT.hasGapAnalysis: Bridge relationship connecting to GA-ONT analysis
ORG-CONTEXT.hasRoleContext: Bridge relationship connecting to VE-RRR-ONT roles and governance

ORG-MAT-ONT.MaturityProfile: Overall maturity assessment container for an organization
ORG-MAT-ONT.SizeProfile: Organization size classification (startup, SMB, enterprise, etc.)
ORG-MAT-ONT.TechAIMaturity: Assessment of technology and AI capability maturity

CL-ONT.CompetitiveLandscape: Market environment including competitors, segments, and dynamics
CL-ONT.MarketSegment: Defined portion of the market with common characteristics
CL-ONT.CompetitorProfile: Detailed information about a competitor organization
CL-ONT.MarketDynamic: Trend or force affecting the market environment
CL-ONT.CompetitiveAdvantage: Sustainable differentiator providing market position benefit
CL-ONT.StrategicOpportunity: Identified market opportunity for strategic action

CA-ONT.CompetitiveAnalysis: Structured analysis comparing organization against competitors
CA-ONT.TargetOrganization: The organization being analyzed (typically the client)
CA-ONT.CompetitorOrganization: Organization being compared against the target

GA-ONT.GapAnalysis: Assessment identifying gaps between current and desired state
GA-ONT.IdentifiedGap: Specific gap or deficiency identified through analysis
GA-ONT.ThreatAssessment: Evaluation of external threats to the organization
GA-ONT.PriorityMatrix: Framework for ranking and prioritizing identified items
GA-ONT.Recommendation: Actionable suggestion derived from gap analysis

VE-VSOM-ONT.VisionComponent: Long-term aspirational statement of organizational purpose
VE-VSOM-ONT.StrategyComponent: High-level approach to achieving the vision
VE-VSOM-ONT.StrategicReviewCycle: Periodic review process updating strategy based on metrics and market changes

VE-OKR-ONT.Objective: Qualitative description of a desired outcome
VE-OKR-ONT.OKRCycle: Time-bounded period for OKR execution (typically quarterly)
VE-OKR-ONT.OKRAlignment: Hierarchical connection between OKRs at different organizational levels

VE-VP-ONT.ValueProposition: Statement of value delivered to customers
VE-VP-ONT.IdealCustomerProfile: Description of the target customer persona
VE-VP-ONT.Problem: Customer pain point or challenge addressed
VE-VP-ONT.PainPoint: Specific frustration or difficulty experienced by customers
VE-VP-ONT.Gain: Benefit or outcome desired by customers
VE-VP-ONT.Solution: Product or service addressing customer problems
VE-VP-ONT.MessagingFramework: Structured approach to communicating value proposition

VE-RRR-ONT.Role: Functional position within an organization with defined responsibilities
VE-RRR-ONT.L0EnterpriseGovernance: Board-level governance roles (Board of Directors, Chairman, Shareholders)
VE-RRR-ONT.L1CoreCSuite: Primary C-Suite executives (CEO, COO, CFO, CTO, CMO, CHRO)
VE-RRR-ONT.L1ExtendedCSuite: Specialized C-Suite roles (CDO, CAIO, CPO, CIO, CSO-SEC, CSO-STR, CRO, CCO, CLO, CISO)
VE-RRR-ONT.L2ArchitectureTrack: Enterprise architecture roles (EA, BA, DA, SA, Solutions, Technical, Integration)
VE-RRR-ONT.L4ApplicationTemplate: Product team roles (Product Owner, Tech Lead, UX Lead, Data Engineer, AI Developer, QA Lead)
VE-RRR-ONT.RACI: Responsibility assignment matrix (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed)
VE-RRR-ONT.VSOMAccountability: Mapping of C-Suite roles to VSOM component accountability

VE-PMF-ONT.ProductMarketFit: Alignment between product offering and market demand
VE-PMF-ONT.MarketValidation: Evidence of market acceptance and demand
VE-PMF-ONT.CustomerSegmentFit: Alignment with target customer segment needs

VE-KPI-ONT.KPI: Key Performance Indicator measuring critical success factors
VE-KPI-ONT.KPITarget: Desired value or threshold for KPI achievement
VE-KPI-ONT.KPIMeasurement: Actual recorded value of a KPI at a point in time

PE-PPM-ONT.Portfolio: Collection of programmes and projects aligned to strategic objectives
PE-PPM-ONT.Programme: Group of related projects managed together for benefits
PE-PPM-ONT.Project: Temporary endeavor to create a unique product or service
PE-PPM-ONT.Milestone: Significant point or event in a project timeline
PE-PPM-ONT.Deliverable: Tangible output produced by project activities

PE-Process-Engr-ONT.Process: Defined sequence of activities producing an outcome
PE-Process-Engr-ONT.Activity: Single unit of work within a process
PE-Process-Engr-ONT.ProcessModel: Visual or formal representation of a process

PE-EFS-ONT.Epic: Large body of work that can be broken down into features
PE-EFS-ONT.UserStory: Description of desired functionality from user perspective
PE-EFS-ONT.Persona: Fictional character representing a user type
PE-EFS-ONT.AcceptanceCriteria: Conditions that must be met for story completion

contextFiltering.contextLevel: Primary filter: PFC (Platform Core - generic/reusable) or PFI (Platform Instance - specific deployment)
contextFiltering.instanceId: PFI instance identifier (e.g., 'BAIV' for Brand AI Visibility)
contextFiltering.productContext: Product-specific filter (e.g., 'AIV' for AI Visibility product)
contextFiltering.orgRolesGovernance: Client-specific role governance rules determining which roles apply
contextFiltering.orgContext: Client organization identifier for org-specific filtering

graphPatterns.HubSpokePattern: Central hub ontology (ORG-CONTEXT) connecting to multiple domain ontologies via bridge relationships
graphPatterns.LineageChainPattern: Sequential flow through ontologies (VSOM→OKR→VP→PMF→EFS) representing value chain
graphPatterns.BridgeJoinPattern: Cross-ontology relationship connecting entities from different ontologies

oaaCompliance.Gate1: Schema Structure - JSON-LD format with proper @context and @type
oaaCompliance.Gate2: Entity Definition - Proper class and property definitions
oaaCompliance.Gate2c: Business Rules - IF-THEN rules with severity levels
oaaCompliance.Gate3: Glossary - Term definitions for all entities and relationships
oaaCompliance.Gate4: Documentation - README, visual guides, framework documentation
oaaCompliance.Gate5: Test Data - Sample instances following 60-20-10-10 distribution
oaaCompliance.Gate6: Registry Entry - Proper registration in unified-registry
